title: Differential graded module
summary: In algebra, a differential graded module, or dg-module, is a Z {\displaystyle \mathbb {Z} } -graded module together with a differential; i.e., a square-zero graded endomorphism of the module of degree 1 or âˆ’1, depending on the convention. In other words, it is a chain complex having a structure of a module, while a differential graded algebra is a chain complex with a structure of an algebra.
